category.title: Group Facilitator

item.title: How to Facilitate a Group
item.description: This video describes how to facilitate a self-reliance group and also describes the differences between a traditional teacher and a self-reliance facilitator. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to: Prepare
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator prepares himself or herself spiritually, prepares the facilities and materials, and reminds the group members to attend. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Lead: My Foundation
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator involves group members in leading the weekly My Foundation discussion. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Lead: Report
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator conducts the Return and Report portion of the meeting and how to motivate people to keep commitments and improve performance. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Lead: Learn
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator conducts the Learn section of a group meeting, including “read,” “watch,” “discuss,” and “practice” subsections. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Lead: Ponder
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator conducts the Ponder section of a group meeting, including getting group members to record impressions of how the things they have learned can be applicable in their lives. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Lead: Commit
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator conducts the Commit section of a group meeting, including helping members understand and make commitments and be accountable to an action partner. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to: Manage Meetings
item.description: This video describes how a facilitator manages a group meeting and encourages participation from each group member. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Go and Do Learning
item.description: This video describes the “Go and Do” learning process, which extends beyond simply learning to pondering, committing, acting, and reporting. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: My Purpose
item.description: This video describes the role and duties of a self-reliance group facilitator. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Laboring Unto Self-Reliance
item.description: Using self-reliance resources to bless the lives of members.

item.description: This video describes the roles and duties of the stake self-reliance committee and each of its members. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: The Stake Self-Reliance Committee Meeting
item.description: A depiction of a stake self-reliance committee meeting, how it is led, and participation by various council members. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Stake Self-Reliance Specialists
item.description: A depiction of the calling, training, and monitoring of stake self-reliance specialists. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Helping Ward Councils
item.description: This video depicts stake leaders training ward council members in self-reliance. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Form Self-Reliance Groups
item.description: This video depicts a “My Path night” to introduce members to the program and shows how members select the course they will pursue. The video also includes individual members’ reactions to the program. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How to Use My Path
item.description: This video shows how a My Path pamphlet may be used to identify those who are not self-reliant and help them choose one of three paths: job search, self-employment, and education. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Joseph and John: Medical Products
item.description: Two self-employment group members discuss how they became business partners through the self-reliance group and how they combined one partner’s idea with the other partner’s resources. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Talking to Customers
item.description: A group member interviews a customer about why he is a patron of a specific business. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Talking to Business Owners
item.description: A group member interviews a produce stand owner about how her business operates. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Selecting the Right Business
item.description: This video discusses critical elements of a successful business: customers and products, our skills and interests, competition and the environment, and income potential. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Business on a Stick
item.description: This animated depiction of an interview of three business owners emphasizes the importance of satisfying customer needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Talking to Suppliers
item.description: A group member interviews a produce supplier about how his business operates. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Don’t Close Your Business: Part I
item.description: A business owner experiences higher costs and diminishing profits in her water business. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Don’t Close Your Business: Part II
item.description: A business owner experiences higher costs and diminishing profits in her water business. Two friends talk to her about how to negotiate with suppliers. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: A Bigger Truck?
item.description: Elder Oaks tells a story of two watermelon salesmen who buy and sell their product at the same price. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: I Don’t Know

item.description: A self-employment group member discusses the importance of record keeping and separating personal and business expenditures. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 5: How do I separate my business and family money?
category.subtitle: Videos: 5

item.title: Daniel and Christiana: General Store
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught him marketing and better customer relations. He also discusses the role of prayer and faith in his business. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Your Water Business
item.description: This video gives instruction on how to keep separate business and personal records, with examples of business and personal income and expense items and how to record them. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Don’t Kill the Chickens: Part I
item.description: A business owner explains to her relative why she cannot sell her business assets to help pay for his new apartment. Part I shows the relative requesting money from the business owner. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Don’t Kill the Chickens: Part II
item.description: A business owner explains to her relative why she cannot sell her business assets to help pay for his new apartment. Part II explains the importance of separating business and personal assets. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Don’t Kill the Chickens: Part III
item.description: A business owner explains to her relative why she cannot sell her business assets to help pay for his new apartment. Part III shows the business owner explaining to the relative why she cannot grant his full request. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Felix: Refrigeration Parts
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught him not only better business practices but how to involve his family and improve his personal life. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Susy: Private School Bus
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses the investment and sacrifice it took to start his business and how it allowed him to no longer have to work on the Sabbath. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Careful with Fixed Costs
item.description: A business owner learns how to recognize the difference between fixed and variable costs to help her in the decision to buy more productive assets. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Bicycle or Chickens?
item.description: A business owner learns how productive assets can help her business make more money, and she discusses with a friend whether she should buy a bicycle or more chickens. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Rosanny: Hot Food
item.description: A self-employment group member discusses how the program taught her to use debt appropriately and how being successful in her business has raised her self-esteem. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: How Much Cash Is Available?
item.description: This video describes how to create a simple cash flow statement to determine if a business owner can afford more assets. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Can I Afford More Assets: Part 1
item.description: A business owner discusses with a friend the importance of understanding the business cash flow in order to determine if she can afford new assets. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Can I Afford More Assets: Part 2
item.description: A business owner expresses gratitude to her friend for helping her understand her business cash flow and avoid excessive loan payments. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 9: How do I know if I should use a loan to grow my business?
category.subtitle: Videos: 5

item.title: Get a Loan?
item.description: Business owners discuss their plans to get a loan for business and consumer purposes. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Right Amount?
item.description: Business owners discuss the effects of borrowing too much and the need to calculate the appropriate amount based upon business cash flow statements. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Right Terms?
item.description: A business owner gets his loan without understanding the basic contract terms. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Right Time?
item.description: Business owners discuss when is the appropriate time to borrow, as well as the need to have been in business long enough to be able to forecast cash flow. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Right Reason?
item.description: Business owners discuss the differences between business and personal loans and borrowing for the right reason. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 10: How will I attract more customers and close sales?

item.title: Ask, Listen, Suggest
item.description: A business owner asks appropriate questions, listens to her customer, and then suggests solutions to meet her customer’s needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Please Buy Something!
item.description: A business owner exhibits overly aggressive sales tactics and loses customers. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Marketing?
item.description: A business owner and friend discuss the benefit of marketing to increase business sales. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Sell, Sell, Sell: Part I
item.description: Part I: An animated depiction of a business owner selling chocolate-covered bananas on a stick. This video addresses the need for market research and satisfying customers’ needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Sell, Sell, Sell: Part II
item.description: Part II: An animated depiction of a business owner selling chocolate-covered bananas on a stick. This video addresses the need for market research and satisfying customers’ needs. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

category.title: Chapter 11: How will I increase my profits?
category.subtitle: Videos: 3

item.title: Turn Inventory Quickly
item.description: Two business owners discuss the need to sell inventory quickly and minimize excess inventory. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: The Upsell
item.description: A business owner recognizes a customer’s need and takes the opportunity to sell a service in addition to the basic product sale. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Made the Sale, Missed the Sale!
item.description: A business owner makes a sale but fails to recognize the customer’s full needs and her own opportunity to make a larger sale. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE
